about 5k absolutely fantastic and a k of

but I think all this comes down to is
the shoe is particularly wide my feet

you've got a lot of space in here and I
couldn't really get it locked down very
very well now we're do went out from the
second testing run of this shoe some
people suggested in my straa comments
and on Instagram to try some heel lock
lacing and that definitely improved
things a little bit and I didn't suffer
any sort of pain at the back of the shoe
quite as much but I really wanted to run
and test this shoe properly so I did add
some plasters or Band-Aids As Americans
say to the back of my ankle and of
course then it went away there was
nothing to rub in so I think all this
comes down to is if you have a
particularly narrow foot you might
suffer some bunching some lockdown
issues and just find it really hard to

that for that first sort of 20 miles so

period is just going to be a little bit

we'll get over that and I'm really
